_description: Charm against thieves — roughly four couplets, then a prose passage, then two couplets

BLSl2584.First Lines:
God was ybore in Bethleem& baptized in Flum Iordan
                    Þerinne was no þefBut God himself þat was ful lefGod
                    & seint TriniteSaue alle þing þat is me lofWiþinne
                    þis hous & withoute& alle þe way
                    aboute…
BLSl2584.Last Lines:
…Ȝif any þeues hider þe wey takeÞat
                    þei stande stille as eny stakeAs euere þer was any
                    ybounde& as euere was þe mulston
BLSl2584.Note: Written as prose; part of a prose text ending further down the page “…be with vs now & euere Amen.”
BLSl2584.Editions:
Smallwood,  T. M. 
             “’God was Born in Bethlehem…’: The Tradition of a
                Middle English Charm.” 
             Medium Ævum
         58 (1989): 206-23: 209-10.
